events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on 2024-04-29 in downtown, requesting to file an insurance claim.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report indicating vehicle damage from a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and initiate the investigation process.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining next steps for vehicle damage assessment.
Request sent to the customer for photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and driver’s license for claim processing.
Customer submitted all requested documents including photos of the damaged vehicle and the official police collision report.
Investigation team began assessment of the vehicle damage and reviewed police report to determine claim validity.
Investigation completed with findings confirming the accident details and extent of vehicle damage as reported by the customer.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer with an offer covering repair costs for the damaged vehicle parts.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the timely assistance provided.
The claim was approved based on investigation results and agreement on the proposed settlement amount.
Payment was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover the approved repairs for the vehicle damage.
The claim was closed successfully after confirming receipt of payment and customer satisfaction with the resolution.
The auto accident claim records were archived as per company policy for future reference and audit purposes.
